fields.description:
h3. Current Situation
Currently, the only way to create an API token is by accessing [https://id.atlassian.com/manage/api-tokens].

h3. Expected Results
Users should be able to generate their API token using CURL
fields.summary: Enable API token creation using CURL

fields.description:
{panel:title=Progress Update}
We are working on building nested group flattening for Azure AD integrations.
{panel}
Atlassian Access currently does not support nested group but there are identity service providers that supports and can user provision them. It would be good to support handling of user provisioned nested groups by flattening.

Note :
 At the moment, when a nested group is provisioned, the members of the nested groups are not provisioned on Atlassian side. Flattening needs to be done on the IDP side.

Example of the nested group:

!group-membership-blade.png|thumbnail!

ref. [Add or remove a group from another group - Azure Active Directory - Microsoft Docs|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/fundamentals/active-directory-groups-membership-azure-portal]
fields.summary: Add support for nested group handling in User Provisioning

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Migrating from Atlassian Server products where SCIM was enabled to Atlassian Cloud and then using Atlassian Access SCIM causes users to be given GUID (or UUID) usernames.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Jira/Confluence server setup connected to an IDP for SCIM.
# Migrate from Server to Cloud using Jira site import.
# Enable Atlassian Access & SCIM in new Cloud site

h3. Expected Results
SCIM will be enabled and users will sync to the IDP and retain their configuration as they did in cloud.

h3. Actual Results
Some users are issued new usernames in the form of UUID's, this breaks the connection to all their historic work done in the server instance. 
 
h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Migrating from Atlassian Server products where SCIM was enabled to Atlassian Cloud and then using Atlassian Access SCIM causes users to be given GUID usernames

fields.description:
{panel:title=Aug 2020 update}
Hi,

We have increase the SCIM provisioning limit to 10K. 

 

Thanks,

Narmada Jayasnkar

Product Manager, Atlassian Access
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

As per [User provisioning - About user provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html#Userprovisioning-Aboutuserprovisioning] the current limit for the user-provisioning feature is 5000 users and once that is reached no other users will be synced.

This becomes a problem for customers that have larger user bases which not only contain their users but also customers from their verified domains.
h3. Suggested Solution

Increase the 5000 synced users limit to unblock these customers.
fields.summary: Increase 5000 synced users limit from user-provisioning

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently if IdP's certificate record used for SAML SSO configuration contains a *newline*, it could cause failure in SSO process. This issue has been addressed in following article:
* [OKTA SAML Atlassian New Integration Setup results in Error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/okta-saml-atlassian-new-integration-setup-results-in-error-946041617.html]

h3. Suggested solution
Implement the functionality to support or handle *newlines* in _Public x509 Certificate_ field for SAML configuration.
fields.summary: Support newlines in public certificate record for SAML configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html] is tied to a cloud site there is no option to remove it hence all the users that need to be added to *site-admins* group must become an *Org Administrator* to achieve that and sometimes this might not be in agreement with the companies internal politics. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Make it possible for Org admins to remove the link to cloud site without the need to delete the Org.

h3. Current workaround
Add the user as a *Org Administrator* directly at https://admin.atlassian.com/ and he/she will be automatically added as to the _site-admins_ groups of the linked cloud sites.
fields.summary: Ability to remove the cloud site association with an Org

fields.description:
{panel:title=Release Update}
Hi Everyone,

I'm pleased to announce that we have shipped this feature request. If you configured your SCIM connection after November 15, 2020, your SCIM connection supports syncing unmanaged users. All user in your identity provider group will sync to Atlassian

If your SCIM connection was configured before November 15, 2020 you will need to opt-in to this feature. You can find more information about opting in on this blog post [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2021/01/easily-provision-users-from-outside-your-verified-domain-to-atlassian-products]

Thanks,
Narmada Jayasankar
Product Manager, Atlassian Access
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Users may often want to use the user-provisioning feature to provision not only their managed users but also third-party users which they don't own the domain but are part of their IdPs userbase.
 Not being able to provision those users forces these customers into manually inviting them which can be painful depending on the size of their userbase.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to provision unmanaged users into the [user-provisioning|https://admin.atlassian.com/o/d2b8234c-aa4d-4596-9d98-5d84f2e3b604/user-provisioning] feature.

*Our ask to customers who would like to use this* – please share with us the following input so that we understand the use cases more accurately:

1. Roughly, the number of users you plan to provision and manage from your IdP:
 # of managed users
 # of external users

2. Which IdP you (plan to) use:
fields.summary: Add the ability to provision unmanaged users through the user-provisioning feature

fields.description:

h3. Environment
* JSD - Only 
* Can have Confluence

A link to Jira Service Desk is shown.

h3. Actual Results
No link to Jira is shown at all. 
!Screenshot 2019-04-05 at 10.29.43.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 23 September 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for voting and commenting on this ticket. I'm excited to announce that all organization admins can now change user avatars for all of their managed accounts! You can learn more about managed accounts at [this link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/managed-accounts-873871203.html]. 

Thanks again for your continued feedback and interaction on this ticket. If you have any questions or concerns, please don’t hesitate to email me at rgarg@atlassian.com

Best, 
 Rak Garg
 Atlassian Product Management
{panel}
There is no link to browse other users profiles when being an admin.
 This removes the ability of changing other users avatars for admins.
 This also removes the ability for admins to access users Project Roles quickly.

*Workaround:*
 Access the Profile Page with the URL:
 instance-name.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=user_name
fields.summary: Provide a way to view a user's public profile to be able to change users' avatars

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Managed Accounts, the product access filter may disappear and does consider the full list of Atlassian products. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Atlassian organization
 # Grant product access to only Confluence and Bitbucket
 # Try to filter by Product Access

h3. Expected Results

The product access filter should work to filter our the following

- Confluence, Jira Software, Jira Service Desk, Bitbucket
- No Product Access

h3. Actual Results

- The filter may not appear. 

 !missing.png|thumbnail! 

- Bitbucket and No Product Access is not considered. 

 !incomplete.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

The information for product access can be extracted from _*Export Accounts*_
fields.summary: Product access filter does not work completely

fields.description:

At the moment the message displayed is this
{quote}
"You can't add members to this group because this site is linked to an organization."
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solutions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the SAML integration available for Atlassian Access only syncs the users' first name and last name into Atlassian's side.

Since the user can configure other attributes at [id.atlassian|https://id.atlassian.com] like Job title, Department and Organization it would be nice if those could be passed through SAML.

Most IdP can pass those at the SAML response but with the current implementation, they are just ignored.

h3. Suggested Solution

Enhance the attributes mapping for Atlassian Access SAML integration so more attributes can be passed/synced from the IdP into Atlassian.

h3. Workaround 

The Atlassian Access [user-provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html#Userprovisioning-Supporteduseraccountoperations] does sync those attributes so it can be used as a workaround.
fields.summary: Support more attributes on SAML integration.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment
Atlassian Access, SCIM integration with Azure AD

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# claim a domain
# manually provision a user in that domain
# integrate AzureAD for user provisioning

h3. Expected Results
AzureAD will try to provision that user once, notice that the user already exists and stop trying
h3. Actual Results
AzureAD keeps on retrying every 20 minutes and the audit log of that organisation is filled with errors that the user already exist. The screenshot below has been redacted due to personal information being present, but the email is the same across all log entries.

 !Administration-6.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
The only theoretical workaround would be a GDPR deletion of that user, followed by Azure attempting to re-provision it. However, this is not feasible, as a GDPR delete will take at least 14 days and also the newly created Atlassian Account will be different, so all the work logged before would not be associated with this new account.
fields.summary: AzureAD keeps on pushing a user if that user has already been manually provisioned before the SCIM integration

fields.description:

 # Roughly, the number of users you plan to provision and manage from your IdP: 
 ** # of managed users
 ** # of external users
 # Which IdP you (plan to) use
fields.summary: Ability to provision external users from non-verified domains to Atlassian cloud products

fields.description:
Summary
There are on rare occasions 500 errors thrown when using the Organizational Rest API endpoint in a script and handling of these errors can be improved

Environment
Atlassian Access Rest API run using a script

Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a script that calls the URL "https://api.atlassian.com/admin/v1/orgs/${DirectoryID}/users" via a curl call
# Run for at least a 2500 list of managed users in the org
# 500 errors like below is randomly thrown for some output users details (less then 0.05% in my test) on condition logging is setup up manually as part of the script
{noformat}
07:52 am NZDT start;DEBUG: 20190304185231: 500 response: https://api.atlassian.com/admin/v1/orgs/<orgID>/users?cursor=<AAID>9:21 am NZDT start;ok09:33 am NZDT start;DEBUG: 20190304203306: 
{noformat}

 
Expected Results
500 errors thrown should be further minimised and if any should be highlighted to administrators one method or rather.

Actual Results
No way to get the error and error does occur at least once per run for my tests  

Workaround
None available
fields.summary: Improved monitoring for Access Organizational Rest API

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 24 June 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. I have good news! We've now increased the amount of time an API token stays valid to 1 year before it expires. New API tokens will now allow you to select an expiration date within 1 year from the day of creation. Your feedback is key to helping us prioritize features and learn more about how we can improve our products for you. 

Thanks for your continued feedback and involvement,
 Rak Garg
 Product Manager, Atlassian
{panel}

The Admin API requires a token API Key to work as highlighted here [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/] 

The only way to revoke the API key now is manually by going to the Admin API page. The preferred method would be to allow a custom expiry length / date for this token or API Key.
fields.summary: Expiry Date Needed for Organisation Rest Admin API Token

fields.description:
At the moment, a site can be attached to an Atlassian Access organization for User Provisioning. 

1. There are cases where the same admins are working on 2 different set of domains, IDP and AA org. An admin may incorrectly attach a site to the wrong org and it won't be possible to unlink the site from the org afterwards. 

2. When discontinuing AA or User Provisioning, it is not possible to unlink a site from an AA org. This causes the site-admin group to be disabled on the site. 

Suggestions :
- Add a unlink/delete button to remove a site from the AA organization. Unlinking should reactivate the site-admin group locally in the cloud site.
fields.summary: Ability to unlink a site from an Atlassian Access Organization

fields.description:

As per [the organization REST API - Get Page of Users in Org|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/#api-orgs-orgId-users-get], 'page[cursor]' should work to get the next page of users in the Organization.

But doing a call with 'page[cursor]' returns nothing.

h3. Expected Results

The endpoint should return the next list of users in the Organization.

h3. Workaround

Replace *page[cursor]=* with *page%5Bcursor%5D=* in the header will work.
fields.summary: REST API - 'page[cursor]' is not working for Get Page of Users in Org

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Organisations which have considerably large user base fail to receive password reset requests that Organisation Administrators carry out. There is no significant error when the Organisation Administrators run the steps but at the backend, the reset password process fails. 
h3. Environment

Only dependency seems to be the number of users and having multiple domains.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Atlassian Access Organisation
 # Claim more then 10 domains under this Organisation
 # Create more then 350 users in these domains
 # Try to reset password policy to strong for all users at this Org , using steps at [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/password-policies-938859739.html] 
 # The steps seem to be successful and you expect users to be prompted to change their password upon next login 

h3. Expected Results
 # Users log out of any current Atlassian Access Cloud session 
 # Close all browsers
 # Login to {{id.atlassian.com}} 
 # They should get the email below then reset password accordingly
    !image-2019-02-14-18-41-59-420.png|width=375,height=319!
 # Or users totally log out of their current browser session and login on an incognito mode of the browser and they should be prompted to change their password

h3. Actual Results

Users on any of the claimed domain never get the reset password email above nor are they prompted ever to reset their passwords
h3. Workaround

No known workaround at present
fields.summary: Applying password policies for Atlassian Access organizations with large number of claimed domains fails
Retrieve users from a directory SCIM endpoint returning 406(Not Acceptable)

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update - 23 March 2021  }
Hi everyone, 

The feature has now been fully rolled out. Our [public-facing documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/resend-a-verification-email-to-a-managed-account/] has been updated to reflect these changes.

Also, note that we have kicked off scoping for a fast-follow functionality that would allow admins to delete accounts that have not yet been verified.   

Best regards,

Ilya Bagrak
Principal Product Manager, Enterprise Cloud
ibagrak (at) atlassian.com
{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update - 24 February 2021  }
Hi everyone, 

I am very excited to share that over the next few days we will begin to roll out a set of features to address this issue. The changes will allow admins to: 
 * see accounts with unverified emails on the Managed Accounts page
 * filter for unverified accounts on the Managed Accounts page
 * resend the verification email to any account that has not yet verified their email address. 

Our [public-facing documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/resend-a-verification-email-to-a-managed-account/] has been updated to reflect these changes ahead of the rollout. 

Best regards,

Ilya Bagrak
 Principal Product Manager, Enterprise Cloud
 ibagrak (at) atlassian.com
{panel}
 
h3. Issue Summary

When a new email address is known to Atlassian either via account creation or email change, the email address needs to be verified so that our system will know that there is a valid mailbox for the email address. If the email address is not verified, the account will not be activated and will cause the following problems.
 - Email change will not proceed.
 - User cannot login using the unverified email address.

For managed accounts, only verified accounts will be listed. Org admins will not be able to identify that the account is unverified when their end user complains that they cannot login to Atlassian. Org admins may also consider the unverified email address as free to use for email address change when it's not.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up an AA organization and claim a domain
 # Invite a new domain user to any Cloud site
 # Skip the verification email for the new domain user
 # Go to *Managed Accounts* in admin.atlassian.com

Invitation pending user is not manageable via REST API as well:
{code:bash}
API_TOKEN="__YOUR_ORG_TOKEN__"
AAID="5e376c2d14836c0cc108afcd"
curl --request GET \
  --user "${USER}:${API_TOKEN}" \
  --url "https://api.atlassian.com/users/${AAID}/manage" \
  --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_TOKEN}" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json"
{code}
{code:javascript}
{
  "key": "forbidden",
  "context": "Error: Caller must be an org admin of targeted account or be the targeted account",
  "errorKey": "forbidden",
  "errorDetail": "Error: Caller must be an org admin of targeted account or be the targeted account"
}
{code}
h3. Expected Results

The unverified domain account should be listed as "unverified". The admin should then have the option to send a new verification email or a password reset email.
h3. Actual Results

The unverified domain accounts are unknown to the Org admins.
h3. Notes

A [password reset email|https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword] can be used to initiate a verification in case the user missed the original verification email.
h3. Workaround

If a domain account is existing in Atlassian Cloud but is not listed under the org's *Managed Accounts*, please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/] to check the status of the account.

To allow an unverified email address to appear under *Managed Accounts*

!error taken.PNG|thumbnail!
 - Launch an incognito browser in Chrome and access [https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword]
 - Send a password reset email to the domain email address
 - Request the user to access password reset email in the domain mail inbox. *Set a password*
 - The password reset will activate the account and it should start appearing under *Managed Accounts*

h4. For Customers using SAML SSO, password resets cannot be sent/used as authentication is enforced through the Identity Provider
 * Use the [Export accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/export-managed-accounts-964968073.html] functionality to get the user Atlassian account id
 * With this ID, navigate to your Organization's Managed Accounts, Show the Details of a Managed Account, and replace the Atlassian account ID with the one gathered from above
 ** Direct link: [https://admin.atlassian.com/o/<orgID>/members/<AtlassianAccountID>|https://admin.atlassian.com/o/%3CorgID%3E/members/%3CAtlassianAccountID%3E]
 * Change the Email Address of the Unverified Account and revert the change and it'll appears in Managed Accounts

KB [Unable to change user email with error saying it is already taken, but the other account is not visible in the organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/unable-to-change-user-email-with-error-saying-it-is-already-taken-but-the-other-account-is-not-visible-in-the-organization-1005791991.html]
fields.summary: Unverified email addresses does not appear under Managed Accounts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Audit log in User provisioning includes troubleshooting information (check [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZNYtOQ] for details) which might not help much to understand the causes for errors in general.

h3. Suggested Solutions

It'd be helpful for the audit log to include successful operations such as:
- updating user name or status as well so that I can compare these operations from those logged in an identity provider (Azure AD, Okta, etc.).
- display who was the Org Admin that enabled/disabled the _*Provisioning*_.

*Example use case:* When a user status is changed from 'Disabled' to 'Active' in my identity provider and not reflected in Atlassian, I can compare the events logged between Atlassian's and IdP'S audit logs and see if the request is received and operated by Atlassian.

(For customers voting for this suggestion, please write down your specific use case or situation where the more comprehensive logging could help so that we understand your scenario.)
fields.summary: Display more comprehensive/relevant logging in User provisioning (SCIM)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a managed user is added to an instance (i.e. abc.atlassian.net) with any application access, that information is updated at the *Managed accounts* > *Edit account* > *Product access* section of that user. However, when that product subscript's ends, that information is not updated in the Org and the user is still related to that product. 

h3. Environment
* [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a managed user from you [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html] to a trial instance with any application access.
# Wait until the trial period end or the subscription ends.
# The product relationship is not updated. 

*Note:* as long as the product subscription is canceled, that won't affect your bill estimate. 

h3. Expected Results
The Org should receive the information that the SEN for that product is not valid anymore and remove the product associated with the users under that Org. 

h3. Actual Results
The product is still displayed in the user's profile in the Org. 
 
h3. Notes
I've tried to create a new instance with the same name related to that old product (i.e. abc.atlassian.net) to check if the information would be updated in the Org side, knowing that this new instance doesn't have that Org user. Nothing changes, the association is still there.
fields.summary: Product access is not removed from the managed accounts' profile after the product subscription ends

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Amount of "Total" and "Deactivated" managed accounts are not displayed in Organization > Overview page:
 !Organization - Overview.png|thumbnail! 

Following error appears in browser's console:
{code}
GET https://admin.atlassian.com/gateway/api/adminhub/organization/<organization-id>/members/total 500 ()
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an organization
# Claim a domain
# Access _Overview_ page in the organization

h3. Expected Results
You can see amount of "Total" and "Deactivated" managed accounts

h3. Actual Results
These fields (Total and Deactivated) do not show any number:
 !Organization - Overview.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Managed account statistics (total, deactivated) are not populated in Overview page

fields.description:
In Atlassian Access, the organization is billed as a whole and there is currently no way to manage users into groups. This gets problematic for bigger organizations in a single domain who have departments and teams that work independently of each other. 

Suggestion :

- Implement groups for administration purposes in Atlassian Access.
- Allow consideration for multi-department organizations in billing
fields.summary: Allow groups for administration of users in Atlassian Access

fields.description:
h3.Summary

As of now, it is possible to export a list of managed users into a CSV file. However due to the absence of the 'last active' column, it is often difficult for organization administrators to determine which users are active and which are not from the UI and the CSV report.

Unless organization administrator is told ahead of time that a user is leaving the company or will be inactive for a period of time, it is currently not possible to tell which user is inactive as admins can't tell when a specific user last login.

Adding the 'last active' date on the managed user list (not having to dig down to user profile) and CSV file will allow for easier user management.
fields.summary: Show 'last active' details of Atlassian account in managed accounts view and CSV export file

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
As per instructions [Domain verification|] page in order to verify a domain using a HTML file the web server must have a valid SSL certificate:
{quote}
h3. Verify a domain over HTTPS

HTTPS is mandatory for hosting the HTML file, and it needs a valid SSL certificate from a certificate authority (self-signed certificates won't work). Only one redirection to a _www_ domain prefix is allowed. For example, if your domain is _example.com_, domains can only be successfully verified for _https://example.com_ or _https://www.example.com_. You can't verify domains that redirect to a second domain.
{quote}

When a domain is verified using HTML file the *Verification type* in _Organization_ (Domains) page is displayed as *HTTP* instead of HTTPS. Please see the screenshot below:
 !Organization - Domains.png|thumbnail! 

This label (Verification type) is misleading as it indicates that the domain is/could be verified without a valid SSL certificate.

h3. Suggested resolution
Please change the _Verification type_ to *HTTPS*.
fields.summary: Domain verification type is showing HTTP instead of HTTPS

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of 24 June 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#4c9aff|bgColor=#deebff}
We have deployed a solution that will automatically detect incorrectly linked SAML Ids and re-link them with the correct user accounts. This fix negates the need for this feature.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

There are some cases where an email is changed (i.e. a@a.com to b@a.com) , however, the SAML Id on Atlassian side is still related to that old Account so when the user tries to log in he receives an error saying that:
{code:java}
login.forbidden.handle-linked-saml-users.update-linked-primary-user-email-failed-400.content
{code}
or _*user is blocked*_

Currently, the only way to resolve these issues is contact support to gather some details regarding the user such as:
 - The [SAML Response|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-view-a-saml-responses-in-your-browser-for-troubleshooting-872129244.html] from the user login attempt.
 - Check the old and new email address.
 - Check in what account the application historic is placed.
 - Check if that account has the correct email address and change it if it doesn't has.
 - Escalate the ticket to the dev team to clear the SAML link.

h3. Suggested Solutions

Create a feature that allows the _Organization Administrators_ to clear the _SAML Id_ link from their managed accounts. That will reduce the number of escalations to the development team since the SAML link can be cleared by the Org Admins or the support team.
h4. Workaround
 # Review the write up on the long term solution to avoid and resolve these issues in future at [SAML login fails for a user whose email was changed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/suEMOQ]
 # If you're unable to resolve this, reach out to support via [https://support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/] to further investigate the issue and the accounts related to it.
 # While working with support, the following can be used as *temporary workaround* so that the affected user can generate a session to the cloud site and continue working.
 ## Go to [https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword] and generate a recovery link for affected email address.
 ## Access the recovery email and click on *Log in to my account*
 ## In the browser tab that popped up, put in the URL of the cloud site https://<site>.atlassian.net
fields.summary: Make it possible for Org Administrators to clear the Managed Accounts' SAML ID

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update 8/17/2020}
Hi everyone,

My team and I have been working on the ability to connect your existing cloud site groups with you IDP groups. We are happy to announce that we shipped this capability today to all customers. Here is a description of how this feature works [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/resolve-group-conflicts-before-syncing-users-1014677306.html] .

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback has been incredibly helpful to our team as we’ve worked on bringing this feature to you.

Cheers!

Narmada Jayasankar

Product Manager, Atlassian Access

njayasankar@atlassian.com

 
{panel}
 

SCIM user provisioning: Allow the Organization's directory to pull groups from the integrated Cloud sites in order to use these same groups for management on the Identity Provider.
h4. For Okta

This would allow Okta to pull the same groups from Atlassian to link with its own groups of users, instead of pushing new groups to a Cloud site to be re-configured on permission level and memberships.
h4. For other IDPs

It would depend on how the Identity Provider handles groups and SCIM integrations.
fields.summary: SCIM user provisioning: Allow the Organization's directory to pull groups from the integrated Cloud sites

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Currently, each user needs to turn off the marketing e-mails in their account's preferences.

h3. *Suggestion*

Change it so the e-mails are set per instance, and grant the ability for admins to turn those e-mails off for all users.
fields.summary: Ability to turn off marketing notifications to all users in the instance

fields.description: Currently, there is no ability to enforce 2 factor authentication for all accounts. You can sign up for Atlasssian Access, but there is no ability to enforce 2 factor for other domains. It not possible to access servers for domains our organization does not own. 2 factor should be enforced by default to protect from brute force attacks.
fields.summary: Turn on 2 factor by default for all user accounts

fields.description:
{panel:title=May 2021 Release Update}
Hi,

We are excited to announce that we have shipped the Authentication policies feature. You can now apply Atlassian Access security policies on a subset of managed accounts using this feature ([https://www.atlassian.com/software/access/guide/elements/authentication-policies#why-apply-multiple-authentication-policies]). We are still in the last leg of the rollout. If your organization doesn’t have the feature yet, file a support ticket ([https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/]) and we will enable the feature for you.

 Thanks,

The Atlassian Access team.
{panel}
h3. Problem definition

Currently when a domain is verified Atlassian accounts become _managed accounts_ for all users using emails under the claimed domain. If an Atlassian Access feature such as SAML SSO or two-step verification is enabled/enforced it will impact all managed accounts across *ALL* Atlassian Access supported products such as Jira Software, Jira Service Desk (agents), Jira Core, Confluence, Bitbucket, Opsgenie, or Trello.
 * Further details and clarifications are available here: [Atlassian Access for Cloud FAQs|https://www.atlassian.com/licensing/atlassian-access]

h3. Suggested resolution

Org administrators must be able to apply Atlassian Access security features to a subset of the managed accounts in the organization and only pay for these accounts.
fields.summary: Allow Atlassian Access security policies to a subset of the managed accounts in an organization

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When *User Provisioning* is enabled in the identity provider (e.g. Okta) and created users through push group from Okta into Cloud site, they are just added to the Okta group in the Cloud site side, and not to default application access group(s).

This creates a problem when the Cloud instance has a lot of existing projects/spaces granted access to default app groups.
h3. Workaround

The admin(s) would need to manually grant synced Okta groups access to existing Jira projects / Confluence spaces. This is a time consuming process if there are more number of projects/spaces in the instance.
fields.summary: Grant users synced from identity providers via SCIM application access by default

fields.description:
After having activated MFA/2FA enforcement, then excluding some users, it is not easy for Admins to see all of the users that have been marked as excluded.
This makes it difficult for Admins to manage that list of users as they will have to manually check the list of all users.

By allowing them to list only users that have been excluded, they can get a much better idea as to who has been manually excluded.

I would also like to note that although it is possible to filter by users who have not yet set up MFA/2FA for their account, they will not be able to filter the results by those that have been manually excluded from that result sub-set.
fields.summary: Allow Admins to list users that have been excluded from 2FA enforcement

fields.description: We have a cloud instance of JIRA, a mixture of JIRA Software and Service Desk. It would be great if we could limit the SSO / SAML functionality to a single (or individual projects). We would like to allow SSO for only Service Desk for example, this way we could allow people in to Service Desk to raise issues for example but not chew up licences in JIRA software.
fields.summary: Allow Single Sign On (SSO / SAML) to be restricted to individual projects

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 23 December 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

I am pleased to announce that we have now added 2SV activation statistics to the admin insights page. You can find the page by logging into [https://admin.atlassian.com|https://admin.atlassian.com/] and navigating to *Security > Insights*. You may need to scroll down to see the chart at the bottom of the page.

Like all other admin insights, 2SV activation statistics are available to customers with a subscription to Atlassian Access or with Premium plans for Jira Software, Jira Service Management, and Confluence: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/insights-998892816.html] 

Thank you,

Ilya Bagrak
 Product Manager, Admin Experience
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow site-admin of an instance to see who has activated two-factor authentication

fields.description: Would like a solution for SAML sign on that the payment is based on number of domains that we want to manage to log our jira instance rather then an pricing billing based on number of users.
fields.summary: payment is based on number of domains managed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, on an Organization, any Org administrators can:
* Add or remove domains.
* Add or remove organization admins.
* Perform any of the actions listed in Managed accounts.
* Subscribe to Atlassian Access and apply security policies on all managed accounts.
* Be added to existing organizations.

As per customer feedback, there should be a more granular approach of the Organization administrators permissions as in many cases the original Organization administrators may only want to grant access to the Managed accounts section to new administrators so they can help on managing users without having the ability to alter billing details or changing any other configuration.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a level of access within the Organization where "super" admins(the creator of the Organization) can select which level of access the other admins will get.

h3. Current documentation

* [Organization administration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html]
fields.summary: Add level of access for Organization administrators
ADFS support for single sign on please!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Although the group page in the site-administration page of an instance does not allow addition or removal of users:
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-30 at 14.44.40.png|thumbnail! 
It's still possible to add/remove users from these groups directly from their user profile.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure user provisioning as per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/configure-user-provisioning-with-okta-957492956.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/configure-user-provisioning-with-okta-957492956.html]
# Access your linked site.
# Access a user that is not part of the synced users and add it to the synced group.

h3. Expected Results

This shouldn't be possible as the group is managed in an external directory and only users assigned at Okta should be present on the group.

h3. Actual Results

The user is successfully added to the group.
 
h3. Notes

On the next sync from the provisioning feature, the group will be restored to the correct data and thus any user that is not part of the group will be removed and any user that should be part of the group and was removed will be added back.
fields.summary: Users can be added and removed from SCIM synced groups

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Okta documentation: [http://saml-doc.okta.com/SAML_Docs/How-to-Configure-SAML-2.0-for-Atlassian-Cloud.html], it stated that
{quote}Atlassian provides you with with unique SP Entity ID and ACS URL values
{quote}
!image-2017-11-09-14-50-23-883.png|thumbnail!

But on your Cloud instance, it will still show [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/] on the SP entity ID field

!image-2017-11-09-14-52-05-268.png|thumbnail!

 

 

Workaround / Update 

Okta's documentation is currently trying to inform customers that there is an upcoming change that Atlassian will be implementing to provide a unique ID. It also that _*only if*_ a customer is presented with a unique ID, then they need to complete the corresponding step in Okta's documentation. 

We are working with with Okta to temporarily remove the reference to the unique ID from their documentation, until it's actually applicable for customers.

For the time being, please ignore the information about the unique SP entity ID.
fields.summary: Inconsistencies in Okta Documentation

fields.description:
If a user is logged in to an external Identity provider (SAML), when they log out of Atlassian account they do not get logged out of the IdP.

This can mean that if a user logs out of an Atlassian product to then try and log in with a different email on the same domain, the login will fail as Atlassian receives a different email from the IdP.

Many SAML providers support 'single sign out' which would solve this issue if integrated.
fields.summary: Logging out of Atlassian account does not log out of SAML provider

fields.description: Org administrators are responsible for managed accounts and are billed for any managed account that has access to an Atlassian Cloud product, even if that product is not managed by the same organization. Org administrators should be able to revoke a users' application access to an Atlassian Cloud product, even if they are not site administrators for that product.
fields.summary: Allow org administrators to revoke application access to any site

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User CSV export includes user accounts that don't show up in 'Managed accounts' page

h3. Environment

* Atlassian Access

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Visit https://admin.atlassian.com and select your organization
# Select 'Managed accounts'
# Click 'Export Accounts'
# Download CSV from e-mail that is sent

h3. Expected Results

CSV contains only accounts that show up under 'Managed accounts' in admin.atlassian.com

h3. Actual Results

CSV contains accounts that don't show up under 'Managed accounts' in admin.atlassian.com

h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: User CSV export includes user accounts that don't show up in 'Managed accounts' page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when a managed user is using enforced 2FA and he needs to disable it because he either lost his phone, bought a new one or accidentally deleted the current 2FA configuration, the user needs to engage the Organization administrators asking for his temporary removal of enforced 2FA.

This becomes a problem when the managed user does not know who the Organization admins are or if the Organization administrators do not want to take actions everytime a user pass through this problem.

h3. Suggested Solution

Give the Organization administrators the option to allow managed users to reset/resync 2FA without the need of interaction from an Org admin.

h3. Notes

Process in place:
* [Enforced two\-step verification \- Temporarily exclude users from two\-step verification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/enforced-two-step-verification-938859738.html#Enforcedtwo-stepverification-Temporarilyexcludeusersfromtwo-stepverification]
fields.summary: Allow managed users to reset / resync / re-enroll 2FA on their own when needed for instance if they have a new phone

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When SAML SSO is enabled for an instance, user's parameter such as email address should be sent to the identity provider for authentication process.

h3. Problem definition
Currently when SAML SSO is configured for a cloud instance user requires to go through the steps below:
# Access the instance login page and enter the username or email address.
# User will be redirected to the identity platform for authentication.
# If the user is not logged in, he/she needs to enter the username or email address again together with the password to login.
# After successful authentication user will be redirected to the cloud instance.

In the current process user requires to enter the username or email address multiple times in step #1 and step #3 above.

h3. Proposed solution
This could be avoid if in the step #2 above some parameters such as username/email be sent to identity provider as well.
fields.summary: Ability to send parameters to identity provider for SAML SSO

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 7 May 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

My name is Rak Garg, and I am a product manager at Atlassian. I have good news! We’ve been hard at work on [Organization and admin insights|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access/guide/elements/organization-insights], which bring lightweight usage reports to admins with Atlassian Access or Premium subscriptions to Jira Software, Jira Service Desk, or Confluence.  Learn more about new usage reporting capabilities on [our Community post here. |https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Access-articles/Stay-on-top-of-product-adoption-with-Admin-Insights/ba-p/1356317]

If you have any questions or suggestions for future reporting functionality, please don’t hesitate to email me at rgarg@atlassian.com or comment on this ticket.

Best,
Rak Garg
Atlassian Product Management
{panel}

We don't have any reporting tools where the Cloud instance administration can retrieve consolidated data about usage statistics, licensing, active sessions (we can see, but can't extract), etc.

In addition, administrators don't have access to any kind of logging to see who created particular users.
fields.summary: Create usage report tools

fields.description: As an Atlassian Cloud site administrator, I would like to remove Application Access for multiple users in a bulk, under 'User Management'.
fields.summary: Revoke Application Access in Bulk

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Certain users who show as active with Application Access to Confluence or Jira at the instance Site Admin or User Management  , do not have application access tagged correctly to them at Atlassian Access
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User is a managed account and managed by Atlassian Access
 # Check in User Management for user application access and he seems to have application access to Confluence for example
 # However navigating to [Managed account|https://admin.atlassian.com/] shows that he has no such product/application access. In this example , he will not show as having access to Confluence at his managed account page.

h3. Expected Results
 # User's product access at [Managed account|https://admin.atlassian.com/] should match his access at User Management Application access

h3. Actual Results

User's access at [Managed account|https://admin.atlassian.com/] shows as no product access
fields.summary: Certain Atlassian Access managed accounts user's product access does not reflect correctly at admin.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Atlassian Access does not reflect a deleted Bitbucket user event correctly at the [Managed Account|https://admin.atlassian.com/]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User is a managed account ie an Administrator controls his account via Atlassian Access  he at one time had Bitbucket access
 # His Bitbucket access is then deleted
 # But he still appears as an Atlassian Access managed account

h3. Expected Results

The user access as an Atlassian Access user should no longer include him and he should not show as a managed account
h3. Actual Results

He still shows as a managed account
h3. Workaround

No workaround for now till the bug is fixed. This user is not chargeable thus impact is only on the view at the Managed Accounts list at Atlassian Access
fields.summary: User delete action for Bitbucket users not captured

fields.description:
Add Shibboleth to the list of [Supported Identity Providers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html#SAMLsinglesign-on-supportedidentityproviders] for SAML under Atlassian Access

Shibboleth is an IdP solutions widely used by educational and government institutions and is a project which grew out of [Internet2|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet2], which is well known within the open-source community

*Workaround:*

Although not currently one of the IdPs that is officially supported under Atlassian Access [SAML single sign-on|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html#SAMLsinglesign-on-supportedidentityproviders], Shibboleth can be used for single sign-on as described in SAML documentation in the section [1. Add the Atlassian product to your identity provider|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html#SAMLsinglesign-on-1.AddtheAtlassianproducttoyouridentityprovider]
fields.summary: Add Support for InCommon's Shibboleth as an IdP

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 3 May 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

I have good news! My team and I have released a new and improved audit log that contains many of the activities mentioned on this ticket. The log currently covers the following activities: 
 * A user was added to a group
 * A group was created / deleted
 * A group’s permissions were altered
 * And many more

This new log works across your entire organization, aggregating events from all of your Jira and Confluence sites into one place. Although it only contains user and group management activities today, we are working on expanding the set of events on an ongoing basis.

To use the log, you must have a valid Atlassian Access subscription or trial. The log can be accessed from: *Organization administration settings -> Security -> Audit log (Beta).* Please be aware that this is a beta version of the feature and you may encounter bugs. If this happens, please file a support ticket or comment on this issue so that we can continue to improve this feature.

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback has been incredibly helpful to our team as we’ve worked on bringing this information to you. We know how important audit logs can be to any organization, and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused you.

We remain focused on bringing more activities to the audit log and would love to hear any feedback you have for us. Please feel free to email me directly at [rgarg@atlassian.com|mailto:rgarg@atlassian.com] if needed.

Thanks,
 Rak Garg
 [rgarg@atlassian.com|mailto:rgarg@atlassian.com]
 Product Manager, Atlassian
{panel}
 
 Have advanced audit features in User management where a site admin can view audit of user who
 * added new users
 * created new groups
 * assigned users to groups
 * revoked a user 
 * deleted a user
 * deleted a Group
fields.summary: Audit log for user management

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Organization Administrators are not able to determine what users that are not active recently and this is a important information to manage accounts hence the costs of the Atlassian Access subscription. For example: The company wants to delete users that have not been active for the last 180 days. 
h3. Suggested Solutions

Add a column to the Organization > managed accounts page that shows the users last authentication (day and time) similar with we have on the instance site admin > users page:
 !image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add to managed accounts page the users' last authentication information

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Lock the edit account feature of managed accounts when SAML is enabled, grey out the full name and email fields.
h3. Problem

When SAML is enabled, your source of truth becomes the Identity Provider (Also known as SSO provider), all account changes to full name and email needs to be done there, if these changes are made under the Atlassian organization, they will be overwritten on the next SSO login of the edited user and in some cases, they may cause a disruption to the user that will need Atlassian support intervention.
h3. Solution details

If we lock/grey out the full name and email fields from the *Edit account* page under *Managed accounts* and add a warning about making the changes on the Identity Provider, we will avoid account issues of this type on the Cloud.
fields.summary: Lock the edit account feature of managed accounts when SAML is enabled

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 12 May 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Thank you for your valuable input and comments. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish.

This suggestion is a priority for our development team, but I am not able to provide an accurate estimate for when this will be resolved. We will update this issue as soon as we can confidently project a release.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Best,
Rak Garg
Atlassian Product Management
{panel}


As part of Atlassian Access, we provided:
* Password Policy
* Enforce 2FA

However, it would be great if we can add the configuration to set a limit of failed login (eg 5) and the subsequent action if hitting that limit. 

If it hits the limit, it also provides configurable actions such as:
* Request admin to reset account before allowing access
* Toggle Captcha
* Sent password reset email to the said user

That would greatly add value for organization admin to prevent brute force attacks and in order to comply with security policy at their end. It will also alert the users to be aware that their account had multiple failed login.
fields.summary: Provide Ability to Set Action After Multiple Failed Login

fields.description: CSV export of managed accounts shows billable users with no product access
fields.summary: CSV export of managed accounts shows billable users with no product access

fields.description:
*Problem*

Currently, Atlassian Access applies a single configuration to an Identity Provider(IdP) for an organization, which applies to all Atlassian accounts on any of that organization's verified domains. This poses a problem for organizations that are using multiple IdPs for users that share the same email domain or if an organization needs multiple SSO/provisioning configurations to support their use cases.

*Solution*

Provide a way for organizations to apply multiple SSO via SAML and/or provisioning(SCIM) configurations to different users on the same domain.
fields.summary: Allow multiple Identity Provider(IdP) configurations for a single org and domain

fields.description:
As admins administrate their managed users, they would like to be able to manage what applications those users have access to from a single centralized area irrespective of their access to those applications without needing to completely disable the account.

I would like to propose that a new feature be added that allows Organization admins to disable accounts at the application level.
fields.summary: Allow Organization admins to manage individual application access.

fields.description:
h3. Description
In some companies, there are separate teams (in different instances) under the same domain which can´t know each other existence. However, when a SAML SSO is set, on the organization side, it is possible to see all users under that domain regardless of the instance. 

h3. Suggestion
- Create a team feature so the org admin can split users into teams.
- Create a different role such as _admin_ which the _Organization Administrator_ can grant it to other users and provide them the power to see and manage their team user (reset the password, change job title, email address, and full name). 

h3. Workaround 
The current workaround for that scenario makes the Organization Administrator only the person of the company that can know all users and teams information such as CTO or CEO of the company. 
So the site admin will need to create the org then add that user as an org administrator. 

Check this documentation for more details: [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html].
fields.summary: As an Organization Administrator, I would like to be able to restrict who can see users at Account management view.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As an Org administrator, I would like to be able to prohibit password reuse for a specified number of generations/password changes.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a feature on Password management's section of the organization page similar to *Password expiry* where the org admin can choose the number of generations/password changes he/she wants to prohibit users from reuse their passwords.
fields.summary: ability to disable password reuse

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Admins are unable to start their Atlassian Access trials and are presented with a Blank Page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As an Org Admin, go to ADMIN.atlassian.com
# Verify a Domain
# Try to start Atlassian Access trial

h3. Expected Results
Admin is able to start trial and/or is presented with a useful error message as to why the trial cannot be started

h3. Actual Results
Admin is presented with a blank white page with no way to proceed

Digging through the Browser Dev Console, we found an error indicating:
"Status 400 - Admin does not have a valid last name"
!image-2018-08-14-10-23-47-676.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
We should present a visible Error Message to the Admin rather than just a blank white screen

h3.Workaround
In this scenario, update your Atlassian account profile to include a valid Last Name
fields.summary: Unable to Start Atlassian Access Trial

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment the *Managed accounts* list is not sortable and can only be search by Name.

h3. Suggested Solution
 It would be good to have the *Managed accounts* list sortable by Name, Email Address for administrative purposes.
If the search could also target the email address in the process it would be even more useful
fields.summary: Make the Managed accounts list sortable
Allow multiple Identity Provider Entity IDs values in SAML configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As an Org administrator, I would like to have the ability to see which users under my organization have the *2FA* enabled or not. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a label/column in the *Managed accounts* section of the Org and when a user is with *2FA* enabled, the column has a (/).
fields.summary: Ability to see if 2FA is enabled or not for the users under my Organization

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
We have implemented a public API for organizations that includes user management:
- https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/ 
- https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/ 
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, admin need to perform it manually to manage the users in Atlassian Access. It will be best if REST API is introduce for this application.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide REST API to manage users in Atlassian Access.

h3. Why this is important
If the admins have lots of users, it will be hard to manage the user manually.
fields.summary: User management REST API in org administration

fields.description:
For security, Organization Administrators should be notified when a new *Atlassian Account* is created with an email address from the org claimed domains. 

This could also be used to notify Organization Admins of potential changes with their Atlassian Access subscription due to additional Managed Accounts being added before the Billing Cycle occurs
fields.summary: Organization Administrators should receive a notification when a new Atlassian Account is associated with their organization.
PTC Integrity with JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As Atlassian Access will be rolled out in the near future for Trello there are some Organization admins that would like the option to prevent that from happening.

The main reason for this is that their users in Trello are at a free tier and once Atlassian Access gets enabled they will start being charged for those users as they will be using Atlassian Access features.

h3. Suggested Solution

Give the Organization admins the option to apply the Atlassian Access features just for the original Atlassian products so their Trello users can remain free of charge.
fields.summary: Trello charges on Atlassian Access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if a site-admin has his domain verified in an Organization but is not aware of it he could wrongly create a new Organization and verify the domain once more since neither the Security section of UM(user management) or admin.atlassian.com have a validation for this.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a notification that advises the user about his domain being verified in an existing Organization.
fields.summary: Implement notification for site-admins that have a verified domain

fields.description:
The following page is outdated:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html

It currently states:
{quote}
h5. Are there any Atlassian Cloud products that SAML isn't available for yet?
SAML single sign-on isn't available yet for Bitbucket Cloud, Trello, or Statuspage, but we have plans to gradually roll out SAML single sign-on for these products.
{quote}

This is not true for Bitbucket, it already supports SAML and is also included at the Atlassian Access product page:
* https://www.atlassian.com/enterprise/cloud/access
fields.summary: SAML Singe Sign on page outdated

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update - November 5 2021  }
Hi everyone, 

This functionality has been rolled out earlier this year, and it is now possible to see unverified accounts on your Managed Accounts page.

Our [public-facing documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/resend-a-verification-email-to-a-managed-account/] has been updated to reflect these changes.

 

Best regards,

Ilya Bagrak
 Principal Product Manager, Enterprise Cloud
 ibagrak (at) atlassian.com
{panel}
------
h3. Problem Definition

Currently admin.atlassian.com does not show the verification status of Atlassian accounts in the UI or CSV export.
h3. Suggested Solution

Would be great to have a feature to export all managed accounts that show their full names, email address, application linked with the account, status (enable or disable), verify status (verified or unverified).
h3. Why this is important

With the unverified status account, the org admin can reverify the account by sending out the verification email. It's also good to know the exact number of the managed accounts so in the event of Server migration, the org admin would know how many users are they expecting not to be imported.
fields.summary: Show verification status of Atlassian account in managed accounts view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Project email address configuration does not recognize G-Suite domain verification

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect your Atlassian Cloud with your G-Suite domain.
# Configure your domain SPF/DKIM records as per this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-900996548.html]
# Set a Project email address.

h3. Expected Results

IF SPF/DKIM records are well configured, the project email validation will pass and it should start working right away.

h3. Actual Results

The project email address will show an error: {color:red}Domain claimed failed for this domain{color}

 
h3. Notes

As outlined in the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-900996548.html], the verification should not be required in G-Suite domains:

bq. If G Suite is enabled, the domain is managed by G Suite and does not require a Domain Verification. Continue with next step...


h3.Workaround

Contact the Atlassian Cloud Support in order to have the workaround applied to your JIRA.
fields.summary: Project email address configuration does not recognize G-Suite domain verification

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Managed accounts users can still reset their password without going through their organization administrators.

h3. Suggested Solution
 Once an account becomes a managed one, prevent users from resetting their password (only organization administrators can reset a managed account password).
fields.summary: Prevent managed accounts from resetting their password

fields.description:
Auditors routinely ask customers about password complexity requirements. Instances that are not subscribed to Access (formerly Identity Manager) cannot control or determine what the requirements are for their users.

Through testing, it was determined that a single requirement currently exists for these customers:
 * 8 or more characters

This information should be clearly documented in an article so that customers can reference our site when auditors ask for the information. This will reduce our support contact index.

 

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/password-policies-938859739.html] already exists but does not clearly delineate what is Access vs non-Access information. We were unable to find the "8 or more characters" requirement on this page.
fields.summary: Password requirements not documented for instances without Access

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 1 October 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

My name is Rak Garg, and I am a product manager at Atlassian. I'm excited to announce that password policy management has been decoupled from Atlassian Access, and is now offered as a core platform feature for no additional cost! To enforce password policies for your users, you'll need to first create (or access) your organization at [admin.atlassian.com|http://admin.atlassian.com/]. From there, follow our instructions to [claim a domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html].

If you've already taken ownership of a domain, then you can immediately start using password policy management for your managed accounts. Thank you for commenting and interacting with this ticket. It's hugely impactful to us as a product development team to understand how best to serve our customers, and we appreciate your time.

If you have any questions or concerns, please don’t hesitate to email me at rgarg@atlassian.com

Best, 
 Rak Garg
 Atlassian Product Management
{panel}
According the documentation you must subscribe to Atlassian Access to enforce password policies.  [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/password-policies-938859739.html] 

Given the state of cyber-security, strong passwords should be a default platform feature for Jira Cloud and not something only available through an additional subscription. 

I understand putting identity provider integration, 2FA, and additional value added password management options behind a subscription (custom expiration, custom rules) given the additional value they provide.  Though I do not see why strong passwords (or at least the option for them) is not considered a default platform configuration.  

Please let me know if I'm misinformed about the default policy for Jira cloud passwords.
fields.summary: Strong password policies should be a core platform feature and not a subscription feature

fields.description:
h3. Summary

[Atlassian organizations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-account-for-admins-873871203.html] allow an organization admin to perform operations on managed accounts:
 * Change the account name and job title.
 * Change the account email address.
 * Temporarily exclude an account from two-step verification.
 * Require a password reset
 * Disable the account

h3. Suggestion

Add the ability to change the account timezone. This will help large or distributed teams because not all users may update that information.
fields.summary: Allow Organization Admin to Change Managed Accounts Timezone

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, you can only search by Email address in the *Managed accounts* menu which is not entirely useful as sometimes email addresses have a specific format that makes searching for a specific user harder.

h3. Suggested Solution
 Allow to search by First Name and Last Name as well.
fields.summary: Allow to search by First Name and Last Name in Managed accounts

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In *Managed accounts*, if you try to change a user's email address to one that is already used by a different Atlassian Account, you get a confusing error message:
{code}
Something went wrong{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change the email address for a Managed account to an email address already used by another account.

h3. Expected Results
User receives the same error message as when they attempt the same from id.atlassian.com:
{code}The provided email address is not allowed, please use a different one{code}

h3. Actual Results
The user receives the following error message:
{code}Something went wrong!{code}
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Improve the error message sent when trying to change an account's email to an already used email address

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The search form for managed accounts doesn't handle multi-byte characters.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Verify an arbitrary domain (such as example.com)
 # Login as an account with the verified domain (such as user1@example.com)
 # Change your full name (display name) to multi-byte characters [https://id.atlassian.com/] (such as "こんにちは")
 # Check that you cannot search your account by querying "こんにちは" from managed accounts

!Screenshot 2018-06-07 15.18.53.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Expected Results

Organization admin can search managed accounts in multi-byte characters. Or, make it searchable by username or email address, not only by display name (full name).
h3. Actual Results

Organization admin cannot search managed accounts in multi-byte characters.


h3. Note

bq. From the Managed accounts page, you can search accounts by name and email address. When you enter search criteria that is more than 3 characters, we return results that match at least 3 continuous characters in your search criteria in addition to results that include the full string.

As documented at [Administer managed accounts for an organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/administer-managed-accounts-for-an-organization-873871203.html], Atlassian Access has a 3-character restriction in search criteria; however, please consider not to apply this restriction to multibyte input because the vast majority of CJK names consists of 1 or 2 characters. For example, my last name "Yamamoto" is very common in Japan, and it is written in 2 characters "山本".



h3. Workaround

-The search form can handle a single multi-byte character. So try to search by 1-character such as "こ" out of "こんにちは". This is a very poor workaround especially for large organizations, but better than nothing.-

None. The workaround introduced here is no longer available because of the 3-character restriction described above.
Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Organization admin cannot search managed accounts in multibyte characters properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently enabling MFA/2FA from the organization page will enable it for all domains that are verified under the organization. If user only want certain domains or users to have 2FA, this is currently not possible. Adoption of MFA/2FA is quite difficult due to the absence of fine-grained configuration.

While it is possible to exempt per uses basis after the MFA activation, it is still not very feasible to exempt it one user at a time if there are a lot of users that needs to be exempted. There is also no way to track from JIRA which users are exempted as well so organization admins will have to keep an external record on which user is exempted.
fields.summary: Users should be able to choose which domain to enable MFA/2FA on

fields.description: It would be very helpful for Organization Admins to be able to exclude specific email addresses from being passed through a setup SSO login system, even if the address is associated with the SSO-linked domain.
fields.summary: Allow Organization admins to exclude specific email addresses from SAML

fields.description:
We are asking for the ability to not enforce all users to set up Two-step verification at once when having an Organization.

Please add a functionality for making possible to selected users choose whenever they feel comfortable to enable Two-step verification.
fields.summary: Not enforce all users to configure Two-step verification when having an Organization

fields.description:
Summary

After a domain is verified, characters can be added to the text record, making the token invalid.

However, the domain status still says VERIFIED and when you verify again it will give you the error:
{quote}
The domain could not be verified!

Uh oh! There was an error trying to verify your domain. Please try again later.
{quote}

Expected Results

The VERIFIED status should not be displayed
fields.summary: Domain Verification > domain status in Org stays verified after token changes

fields.description:
Right now, users can bypass the SAML SSO login if they have Google accounts.

It would be great to let the administrator enforce SAML SSO login so users won't have access to Atlassian applications with their Google accounts.
fields.summary: Enforce SAML SSO login for users with Google accounts.

fields.description: When searching for users in Identity manager it is sometimes necessary to search by a case sensitive or by an exact match of the username, searching by the email address doesn't return any results
fields.summary: User searches in Identity Manager need to be case sensitive or the exact user match

fields.description:
Summary

Some accounts are not displayed in the Managed Account list but they can be found either by searching or visually spotting them in the list

Additionally, the sorting order on the last pages isn't working correctly

Workaround

Contact support and request we locate the account by its internal ID since that value is not exposed for to customers to leverage
fields.summary: Some accounts do not show in the Managed Account list
